name: NewsCatcher
headline: News API for risk and data teams
description:
We help data & risk enterprise teams get instant access to news and events from over 40,000 news sources. 

Our main product is a News API to search through an indexed database of online-published news articles in near real-time.

“Humans reading the news” is not a scalable way for enterprises to analyse news, and it’s expensive. We help enterprises shift the news consumption from just reading to integrating actionable signals into their internal workflow.

founders.name: Artem Bugara, Founder
founders.description:
Artem Bugara is the co-founder, CEO of NewsCatcher. Artem works with data and risk teams to help them integrate actionable signals from online news. Previously he ran a team of data engineers for one of the largest underwriting companies within the aviation, energy, and space insurance sectors.

He earned a degree in Econometrics from Toulouse School of Economics.

founders.name: Maksym Sugonyaka, Founder
founders.description:
Maksym Sugonyaka is the co-founder and CTO of NewsCatcher. After one year of a stable job, Maksym understood that the only place where he could realize his potential was entrepreneurship. Now in NewsCatcher, Maksym is the one to take key strategic and technical decisions in order to make the best News API on the market. 

He has a Master's Degree in Data Science and Finance from Paris Sorbonne. But then,  he became a self-taught Data Engineer.

## Get better news data
Expansive insights, worldwide reach. We deliver a panoramic view of news across the globe through our News API, ensuring you have the world's pulse at your fingertips.
### Global Coverage
Expansive insights, worldwide reach. We deliver a panoramic view of news across the globe, ensuring you have the world's pulse at your fingertips.
### Advanced Filtering
Refined news data at your fingertips. Our precise filters deliver relevance, empowering informed business decisions.
### Custom Solutions
Bespoke data integrations for unique needs. We craft tailored solutions for a seamless fit with your operational workflow.
## Get more control over your searches
Let’s suppose you want to search about articles that mention Amazon and Alexa within 10 words...
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/668e53c30bd9e07612340c33/66a5f2262d9cc6dffce7e239_Proximity%20Search.avif)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/668e53c30bd9e07612340c33/66a5f225e914c7fbfa1c079c_Rank%20Filtering.avif)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/668e53c30bd9e07612340c33/66a5f225b512d03cf2ace477_Headline%20Targeting.avif)
## Get more control over your searches
Let’s suppose you want to search about articles that mention Amazon and Alexa within 10 words...
Proximity Search
**You begin with a proximity search:** NEAR("Amazon", "Alexa", 10). This query yields a diverse collection of some articles discussing various aspects of Amazon and Alexa in a close context (within 10 words of both the keywords).
Rank Filtering
**Next, you apply the rank filter** :rank < 100. This refinement narrows down your results to the top three most influential articles, highlighting significant developments or announcements.
Headline Targeting
Finally, applying the is_headline flag, you’re left with the most impactful frontpage story.
## ADVANCED CLUSTERING
In the fast-paced world of news, redundancy is a common issue. To address this, NewsCatcher API smartly groups search results into clusters of similar articles, enabling your analysts to focus on diverse insights without the hassle of sifting through repetitive content. ‍Let’s suppose you want to search about articles talking about Zero-Day exploits. The News API by NewsCatcher works in two steps:
<Initial Search>
Gather a collection of articles discussing recent zero-day exploits.
<Clustering Application>
The API clusters these articles based on similarities in their titles, content, and summaries.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/668e53c30bd9e07612340c33/668ec6bf96f0e84c09edba05_advanced_clustring.avif)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/668e53c30bd9e07612340c33/668ec6be51a9bb56a4bba0f4_news_with_context.avif)
## Navigating News with Context
<Industry Standard Tagging>
Navigating through the vast sea of news articles requires more than just keywords – it requires context. That's where NewsCatcher's industry-standard tagging comes into play.

## </BUILD vs BUY>
### BUILD
Building in-house means dedicating resources to develop, maintain, and continuously update your own news data extraction and analysis tools.
  * Time-consuming setup for multiple sources
  * Ongoing maintenance for source changes
  * Complexity of writing custom scrapers
  * Inconsistent data extraction methods
  * Continuous data cleaning and NLP
  * Feature development required


### BUY
Buying from NewsCatcher allows you to leverage our specialized, ready-made technology for immediate, comprehensive news data solutions.
  * Quick integration with existing systems
  * Zero maintenance, we handle source changes
  * Advanced, ready-to-use extraction technology
  * Effortless scaling with 70,000+ sources
  * Out-of-the-box data cleaning with
  * Sophisticated NLP features

## FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
[Product](https://newscatcherapi.com/<#w-tabs-1-data-w-pane-0>)[Compliance and Security](https://newscatcherapi.com/<#w-tabs-1-data-w-pane-1>)[General](https://newscatcherapi.com/<#w-tabs-1-data-w-pane-2>)
How many news websites does NewsCatcher index?
NewsCatcher indexes over 90,000 news sources worldwide, ensuring comprehensive global insights.
Does News API by NewsCatcher provide the full text for the articles?
We provide the full text for most articles. Access might be restricted in instances of hard paywalls.
Do you scrape articles behind paywalls?
NewsCatcher collects only publicly available news articles.
How much historical data do you have?
Our production API has articles going back to January 2019. For some sources, we have article dumps going back as far as 2017.
What is the latency from publication on a source and the time it hits your News API?
Depending on the subscription, you can have near-instant access to published articles through our API. Most content is accessible within 10 minutes or less, while small publications may take some time (up to an hour) for article availability.If you have a list of priority sources that you want lower latency on, we can add those to our faster pipeline for faster data ingestion.
Does NewsCatcher provide Service Level Agreements (SLA)? If yes, what kind?
We offer up to 99.95% API uptime and up to 99% per-source coverage SLA. Additionally, we're committed to integrating news sources upon request, ensuring our service evolves with your needs.
Can I request you to cover a new source in the API?
Publicly available sources can be added upon request, expanding your access to critical information.
Does the API support entity resolution to identify specific companies or individuals in news articles?
We developed a pipeline for entity resolution, however the main production API doesn’t support it. Get in touch with us to see examples and get access.
What is your pricing?
Our pricing varies based on several factors, including the specific product, call volume, service level agreements (SLA), historical data access, and optional add-ons such as translation services, custom pipelines, and dedicated resources. For a tailored quote, please [contact our sales team](https://newscatcherapi.com/<https:/www.newscatcherapi.com/pricing>).
What is publicly available news/data?
Publicly available news articles is data that is freely accessible to anyone. It can come from various sources, including governments, businesses, news publishers, and research institutions. Publicly available news articles can be used for various purposes, such as research, journalism, and business intelligence.Legally, the definition of publicly available data varies from country to country. However, in general, publicly available data is data that is freely accessible to anyone without the need for special permissions or privileges.The main difference between publicly available data and private data is that publicly available data is free and accessible to anyone. In contrast, private data is only accessible to specific people or organizations.NewsCatcher collects only publicly available news articles.
Does NewsCatcher collect personal data?
NewsCatcher collects publicly available data only, i.e., information that does not require login or acceptance of TOS. We do not engage in personal data collection
Does NewsCatcher prohibit any particular use cases?
We advocate for fair use, opposing the republishing of copyrighted material, especially to protect media houses from content misappropriation.
Does NewsCatcher have SOC2 Certificate?
A SOC2 certification is anticipated by Q4 2024, underscoring our commitment to robust security standards.
How robust is NewsCatcher infrastructure?
Our architecture leverages multiple cloud providers and data centers, fortified with disaster recovery plans and stringent security protocols for unparalleled data protection.
How many customers does NewsCatcher serve?
Serving 80+ paid customers and offering free access to 250+ researchers and students, we're committed to democratizing news data access. [Check out our FREE News API here.](https://newscatcherapi.com/</free-news-api>)
Do you work with governments?
We maintain partnerships with various government entities, including Central Banks, reflecting our trusted status in critical sectors.
Do you provide dedicated customer service?
Enterprise clients benefit from a dedicated customer success manager, complemented by a streamlined support platform for efficient issue resolution, source requests, and feature suggestions.
Can you help us build our analytics pipeline for news?
We actively work with enterprise clients to develop tailored data pipelines, maximizing the utility and impact of news data for their specific objectives.
How long has NewsCatcher existed?
We started working on the project in February 2020, so it’s been around for a while. But we officially registered the company in 2021.

## Get more control over your searches
Let’s suppose you want to search about articles that mention Amazon and Alexa within 10 words...
Proximity Search
**You begin with a proximity search:** NEAR("Amazon", "Alexa", 10). This query yields a diverse collection of some articles discussing various aspects of Amazon and Alexa in a close context (within 10 words of both the keywords).
Rank Filtering
**Next, you apply the rank filter** :rank < 100. This refinement narrows down your results to the top three most influential articles, highlighting significant developments or announcements.
Headline Targeting
Finally, applying the is_headline flag, you’re left with the most impactful frontpage story.
## ADVANCED CLUSTERING
In the fast-paced world of news, redundancy is a common issue. To address this, NewsCatcher API smartly groups search results into clusters of similar articles, enabling your analysts to focus on diverse insights without the hassle of sifting through repetitive content. ‍Let’s suppose you want to search about articles talking about Zero-Day exploits. The News API by NewsCatcher works in two steps:
<Initial Search>
Gather a collection of articles discussing recent zero-day exploits.
<Clustering Application>
The API clusters these articles based on similarities in their titles, content, and summaries.

Building in-house means dedicating resources to develop, maintain, and continuously update your own news data extraction and analysis tools.

  * Ongoing maintenance for source changes
  * Complexity of writing custom scrapers
  * Inconsistent data extraction methods
  * Continuous data cleaning and NLP

## FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
Product⟨32⟩Compliance and Security⟨33⟩General⟨34⟩
How many news websites does NewsCatcher index?
NewsCatcher indexes over 90,000 news sources worldwide, ensuring comprehensive global insights.
Does News API by NewsCatcher provide the full text for the articles?
We provide the full text for most articles. Access might be restricted in instances of hard paywalls.
Do you scrape articles behind paywalls?
NewsCatcher collects only publicly available news articles.
How much historical data do you have?
Our production API has articles going back to January 2019. For some sources, we have article dumps going back as far as 2017.
What is the latency from publication on a source and the time it hits your News API?
Depending on the subscription, you can have near-instant access to published articles through our API. Most content is accessible within 10 minutes or less, while small publications may take some time (up to an hour) for article availability.If you have a list of priority sources that you want lower latency on, we can add those to our faster pipeline for faster data ingestion.
Does NewsCatcher provide Service Level Agreements (SLA)? If yes, what kind?
We offer up to 99.95% API uptime and up to 99% per-source coverage SLA. Additionally, we're committed to integrating news sources upon request, ensuring our service evolves with your needs.
Can I request you to cover a new source in the API?
Publicly available sources can be added upon request, expanding your access to critical information.
Does the API support entity resolution to identify specific companies or individuals in news articles?
We developed a pipeline for entity resolution, however the main production API doesn’t support it. Get in touch with us to see examples and get access.
What is your pricing?
Our pricing varies based on several factors, including the specific product, call volume, service level agreements (SLA), historical data access, and optional add-ons such as translation services, custom pipelines, and dedicated resources. For a tailored quote, please contact our sales team⟨35⟩.
What is publicly available news/data?
Publicly available news articles is data that is freely accessible to anyone. It can come from various sources, including governments, businesses, news publishers, and research institutions. Publicly available news articles can be used for various purposes, such as research, journalism, and business intelligence.Legally, the definition of publicly available data varies from country to country. However, in general, publicly available data is data that is freely accessible to anyone without the need for special permissions or privileges.The main difference between publicly available data and private data is that publicly available data is free and accessible to anyone. In contrast, private data is only accessible to specific people or organizations.NewsCatcher collects only publicly available news articles.
Does NewsCatcher collect personal data?
NewsCatcher collects publicly available data only, i.e., information that does not require login or acceptance of TOS. We do not engage in personal data collection
Does NewsCatcher prohibit any particular use cases?
We advocate for fair use, opposing the republishing of copyrighted material, especially to protect media houses from content misappropriation.
Does NewsCatcher have SOC2 Certificate?
A SOC2 certification is anticipated by Q4 2024, underscoring our commitment to robust security standards.
How robust is NewsCatcher infrastructure?
Our architecture leverages multiple cloud providers and data centers, fortified with disaster recovery plans and stringent security protocols for unparalleled data protection.
How many customers does NewsCatcher serve?
Serving 80+ paid customers and offering free access to 250+ researchers and students, we're committed to democratizing news data access. Check out our FREE News API here.⟨36⟩
Do you work with governments?
We maintain partnerships with various government entities, including Central Banks, reflecting our trusted status in critical sectors.
Do you provide dedicated customer service?
Enterprise clients benefit from a dedicated customer success manager, complemented by a streamlined support platform for efficient issue resolution, source requests, and feature suggestions.
Can you help us build our analytics pipeline for news?
We actively work with enterprise clients to develop tailored data pipelines, maximizing the utility and impact of news data for their specific objectives.
How long has NewsCatcher existed?
We started working on the project in February 2020, so it’s been around for a while. But we officially registered the company in 2021.

generated_description:
**Company Overview: NewsCatcher**

Founded in 2021 and hailing from Kyiv, Ukraine, NewsCatcher is an innovative startup that emerged from Y Combinator's Batch S22. The company's mission is clear: it aims to revolutionize the way data and risk teams access and utilize news through its specialized News API. 

**Why NewsCatcher?**

Traditional methods of news consumption—think humans poring over articles—aren't just tedious; they're far from scalable and incredibly costly for enterprises. NewsCatcher shifts this paradigm by providing instant access to news from over 40,000 sources, allowing companies to integrate valuable, actionable insights directly into their internal workflows. Their focus is on transforming passive news reading into dynamic, data-driven decision-making.

**Product Features:**

At the heart of NewsCatcher's offerings is their robust News API, which allows users to search through a meticulously indexed database of online news articles in near real-time. Here are some features that stand out:

- **Global Coverage**: NewsCatcher provides expansive insights across numerous regions, putting the world’s news pulse firmly at your fingertips.
- **Advanced Filtering**: With refined search capabilities, enterprises can obtain highly relevant articles tailored to their specific needs, paving the way for informed decisions.
- **Custom Solutions**: Recognizing that no two businesses are the same, NewsCatcher offers bespoke integrations that seamlessly fit into existing operational workflows.
- **Entity Disambiguation**: This feature ensures clarity by accurately identifying the companies or individuals mentioned in articles, cutting through the noise.

**Use Cases:**

The NewsCatcher API caters to a variety of business functions:
- **Risk Analysis**: Monitor live events and their implications for business continuity.
- **Sales Intelligence**: Empower sales teams with timely, relevant news to strategize effectively.
- **Media Monitoring**: Track mentions of brands or topics to gauge public sentiment and media coverage.
- **Market Research**: Utilize vast amounts of news data to uncover trends and insights.

Currently, the company has a team of 18 employees, with Michael Seibel serving as their Group Partner, and they are tagged as a player in the SaaS, big data, and AI spaces.

**Future Prospects:**

NewsCatcher’s commitment to providing actionable news data means they are not just serving existing clients (over 80 paid customers and 250+ researchers and students) but also positioning themselves as a go-to solution for entities—including governments—that need reliable, real-time news for informed decision-making. 

As businesses increasingly recognize the value of swift access to relevant news data, NewsCatcher is well-placed to lead this transformation, transcending traditional media constraints and harnessing technology to offer an unparalleled news experience.

For more information, you can visit their website: [NewsCatcher](https://newscatcherapi.com).
